text: <extra_id_0> Interleukin (IL)-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibits nuclear factor kappa B ( NF kappa B ) activation in human monocytes .
<extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> suppress cytokine synthesis by different mechanisms .

Our previous studies in human monocytes have demonstrated that <extra_id_0> interleukin (IL)-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibits lipopolysaccharide ( LPS ) - stimulated production of inflammatory cytokines , <extra_id_0> IL-1 beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> tumor necrosis factor (TNF)-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> by blocking gene transcription .

text: Using electrophoretic mobility shift assays ( EMSA ) , we now show that , in monocytes stimulated with LPS or <extra_id_0> TNF alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibits nuclear stimulation of nuclear factor kappa B ( NF kappa B ) , a transcription factor involved in the expression of inflammatory cytokine genes .

Several other transcription factors including <extra_id_0> NF-IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> AP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> AP-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> GR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> CREB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> Oct-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> Sp-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are not affected by <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: This selective inhibition by <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> of NF kappa B activation occurs rapidly and in a dose - dependent manner and correlates well with <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> 's cytokine synthesis inhibitory activity in terms of both kinetics and dose responsiveness .

Furthermore , compounds such as tosylphenylalanyl chloromethyl ketone and pyrrolidinedithiocarbamate that are known to selectively inhibit NF kappa B activation block cytokine gene transcription in LPS - stimulated monocytes .

Taken together , these results suggest that inhibition of NF kappa B activation may be an important mechanism for <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> suppression of cytokine gene transcription in human monocytes .
<extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , another cytokine that inhibits cytokine mRNA accumulation in monocytes , shows little inhibitory effect on LPS - induced NF kappa B activation .

Further examination reveals that , unlike <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> enhances mRNA degradation and does not suppress cytokine gene transcription .
These data indicate that <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibit cytokine production by different mechanisms .
